page.title: 08EMPLOYMENT IN BARNOLDSWICK
page.content: Barnoldswick was once a thriving cotton town.Cotton mills employed most of the town's work force.As they began to close in the 1950's and 60's many small firms took over the mills and now employ many people in various industries such as light engingeering, printing,fabrics,plastics and filters. The two biggest employers are Rolls Royce and Silentnight.In our school a lot of the dads work at Rolls Royce making parts for R.B.211 Areo Engines. R.B.stands for Rolls Barnoldswick. Quite a few mums and dads work at Silentnight making beds and mattresses. At present only about half the factory is working as the others are on strike over a pay rise. The unemployment level in Barnoldswick is around 15%.
